summary: PEDV is an enveloped, positive-stranded RNA virus in the genus Alphacoronavirus, family Coronaviridae, order Nidovirales (1, 2). PEDV is the causative agent of porcine epidemic diarrhea (PED) the disease has broken out frequently in many pig-producing countries (4–9) several viral proteins acting as IFN-I antagonists have been identified in members of the family Coronaviridae. PEDV suppresses the IFN-I signaling pathway by inducing STAT1 degradation in a proteasome-dependent manner.
